item.title: Hiding Processes
item.description: Malware is not going to just always sit there and sing üé∂. Below are common techniques. More detailed explanation is in the anti-forensics section.

item.title: Forged Image Detection
item.description: https://29a.ch/photo-forensics/#forensic-magnifier Images can be forged or cloned. Regions can be manipulated with. Hard to detect with naked eye.

item.title: Hiding Data
item.description: Alternative data stream Alternate data streams. Specific for Windows. See more here. Are there such streams for other OS?

item.title: Turning Off Logging
item.description: macOS From Apple’s official documentation: In some cases, the contents of a volume are sufficiently secret that it is not appropriate to log them.

item.title: USBKill Switch
item.description: A software that could be used for anti-forensics. By default, configs are at /etc and named usbkill.
